raw_text:
Prodigy Monfils blows away Gaudio
 
 French prodigy Gael Monfils underlined his huge promise by beating French Open champion Gaston Gaudio 6-4 7-6 (7-4) in the first round of the Qatar Open.
 
 The 18-year-old wild card won three of the four junior Grand Slam events last year, including Wimbledon. Fabrice Santoro, the 2000 champion, beat Sweden's Thomas Johansson 6-4 6-2 but fourth seed Mikhail Youzhny lost 6-3 7-6 (7-3) to Rafael Nadal. Roger Federer plays Greg Rusedski in the second round on Wednesday. Monfils, who was given a wildcard into the tournament, said: "This is my first win over a top 10 player and I am delighted. "I play my best tennis when I am fired up on the court and the reason I won today was because I was able to play my natural, attacking game," he said. "Of course I was a bit tired in the second set. But I was confident I could survive had there been a third set."
llama3.2:1b: Gael Monfils beats Gaston Gaudio 6-4 7-6 (7-4) at Qatar Open, winning three junior Grand Slam events last year including Wimbledon.

Monfils is an 18-year-old wild card who won Wimbledon last year.
He has defeated top 10 players and said he plays best when energized on court.

Monfils won three junior Grand Slam events last year, including Wimbledon, and was given a wildcard to participate in the tournament.
He said he is delighted to be playing his best tennis when fired up on the court and that he played his natural attacking game during the match.

At 18, Monfils won three junior Grand Slam events last year, including Wimbledon.
He expressed joy over this victory and credited his confidence and natural game for winning despite feeling tired in the second set.
Fellow French player Fabrice Santoro defeated Thomas Johansson, while fourth seed Mikhail Youzhny lost to Rafael Nadal.
Roger Federer faces Greg Rusedski in the next round.
opencoder:1.5b: "Prodigy Monfils, who won the French Open 6-4 against Gaston Gaudio, underlined his huge promise by beating the top scorer of the 18-year-old wild card in Wimbledon.
Fabrice Santoro beat Thomas Johansson 6-4, but Mikhail Youzhny lost 6-3 to Rafael Nadal, and Roger Federer played Greg Rusedski on Wednesday.
Monfils was pleased with his first win over a top-tier player - his ability to play best tennis when he's tired - and his confidence in survival had been astounding."

He also won Wimbledon and was given a wildcard into the tournament, beating Sweden's Thomas Johansson 6-4 7-6 (7-3).
The 18-year-old wild card winner played his best tennis when he was fired up on the court and the reason he won today was because he was able to play his natural, attacking game.
He said: "This is my first win over a top 10 player and I am delighted."
He also said: "Of course I was a bit tired in the second set.
But I was confident I could survive had there been a third set."

Gaivo was a top French player but not a top seed.
Monfils, as a wildcard, celebrated his first win over a top 10 player and expressed pride in playing best tennis when under pressure.
He admitted to being tired in the second set but confident he could defend his spot if the third set continued.
tinyllama:1.1b: The 18-year-old wild card Monfils took down 2016 Open champion Gaudio, winning their first-round match with ease, 6-4 7-6 (7-4).
The Frenchman is known for his attacking game and has already made a mark on the tennis world.
Federer plays against Russkiski in the second round, while Stefanos Tsitsipas takes on Guido Andreozzi in his bid to reach the quarterfinals.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Gael Monfils, a talented young French prodigy, secured his first victory over an elite top-10 player at the Qatar Open.
This marked the beginning of an impressive tournament for him, as he continued to showcase his impressive skill and potential on the tennis court.
Despite facing several challenges throughout the match against Wimbledon champion Thomas Johansson, Monfils remained focused and managed to come away with a 6-4 victory.
This impressive performance was just one in a series of victories for the 18-year-old as he continues his journey on the tennis circuit.
